00012 #ifdef CREATE_INTERNALS

00014 void hub_internals_createone(t_hub *x, char *classname, char *subscribername, char *subscribertype, char *ramptype)
00015 {
00016         t_object        *obj = NULL;
00017         t_atom          a[5];
00018         
00019         atom_setsym(a+0, gensym(subscribername));
00020         atom_setsym(a+1, gensym("@type"));
00021         atom_setsym(a+2, gensym(subscribertype));
00022         atom_setsym(a+3, gensym("@ramp"));
00023         atom_setsym(a+4, gensym(ramptype));
00024         jcom_core_loadextern(gensym(classname), 5, a, &obj);
00025 //      obj = (t_object *)object_register(CLASS_BOX, symbol_unique(), obj);                     // register the class so we can attach to it
00026         linklist_append(x->ll_internals, obj);                                                  // keep track of all our internals using a linklist
00027 //      object_attach_byptr(x, obj);                                                                    // listen to the object (will send us info through our "notify" method)
00028 }
00029 
00030 
00031 void hub_internals_create(t_hub *x)
00032 {
00033         
00034         x->ll_internals = linklist_new();
00035 
00036         hub_internals_createone(x, "jcom.parameter", "testparam", "msg_float", "linear.sched");
00037 
00038 
00039 /*
00040         // CURRENTLY A PROBLEM WITH PARAMETERS: pattr cannot find it's box from inside of here...

00043         // EXCEPT FOR THE ui/freeze WHICH IS USED TO SET THE MENU (i think)
00044         // ALL OF THE MESSAGES TO THE HUB FOR THESE ARE HANDLED MANUALLY IN THE HUB
00045         // THESE ARE HERE FOR DOCUMENTATION PURPOSES ONLY

00052         hub_internals_createone(x, "jcom.message",      "ui/refresh",                           @type msg_none @description "Update displayed values for module to reflect current state.";
00053 
00055         hub_internals_createone(x, "jcom.parameter","ui/freeze",                                @type msg_toggle @repetitions 0 @description "Turn off the updating of user interface elements when parameters change.  This may be done to conserve CPU resources.";
00056 
00057         hub_internals_createone(x, "jcom.message",      "module/view_internals",        @type msg_none @description "Attempts to open the internal algorithm for viewing.  This works for most modules.  Some modules may choose to cloak the algorithms - preventing this message from functioning.";
00058         hub_internals_createone(x, "jcom.message",      "preset/default",                       @type msg_none @description "Open the default preset file and recall the first preset in that file.";
00059         hub_internals_createone(x, "jcom.message",      "preset/write",                         @type msg_symbol @description "Write an xml-preset file to disk.  An optional argument defines the file to open.";
00060         hub_internals_createone(x, "jcom.message",      "preset/read",                          @type msg_symbol @description "Open an xml-preset file and recall the first preset in that file.  An optional argument defines the file to open.";
00061         hub_internals_createone(x, "jcom.message",      "preset/recall",                        @type msg_float @description "Recall a preset by number - you can also choose presets from the module menu.";
00062         hub_internals_createone(x, "jcom.message",      "preset/store",                         @type msg_int @description "Store a preset by number in memory.  All presets present in memory will be written to disk when you send a save_settings message to the module.";
00063 
00064         // ONE POTENTIAL WAY TO RE-WRITE THE PRESET IMPLEMENTATION IS TO MAKE THE FILE REFERENCE AN ATTRIBUTE
00065         // THEN WE JUST read (re-read), save (re-save), etc.  Maybe this is a dumb idea though...
00066 */
00067

00080 
00081 void hub_internals_destroy(t_hub *x)
00082 {
00083         linklist_clear(x->ll_internals);
00084         object_free(x->ll_internals);
00085         x->ll_internals = NULL;
00086 }
00087 
00088 
00089 void hub_internals_notify(t_hub *x)
00090 {
00091         ;
00092 }
